alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 13 at 7:47PM MDT until April 14 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT FRIDAY FOR MUCH OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Winds are beginning to decrease in speed, and as temperatures cool through the evening the humidity will rise, causing critical fire weather conditions to come to an end. However, another round of critical fire weather conditions is expected to return on Friday across much of eastern New Mexico and potentially into central portions of the state as well. Winds will re-strengthen through the late morning and early afternoon Friday with another round of low humidity. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT FRIDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (Zone 104), Central Highlands (Zone 125) and East Central Plains (Zone 126) from noon to 8 pm MDT Friday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts near 40 mph on Friday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 10 to 15 percent Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Plains
